Name: May Applause Greet You
Description: It seems like the nearby hunting camp was attacked. Go check it out.
QuestDesc: It seems like the nearby hunting camp was attacked. Go check it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What happened at that camp over there?

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can sense it. Something dark, filthy, and dangerous...

Dialogues.Speaker: Worried Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It feels urgent, but I've still got things to take care of here...

Options.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. I'll go check it out.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hold a moment, young warrior...

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It shames me to ask this of you, but… I don't know who else to turn to.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Could you help me find my children?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide ravages everything in its path. So many innocent lives lost. And the ones who went mad turned the camp upside down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: See the claw marks around camp? My friends, fallen. My children, missing. And I... I can't lift a sword with these injuries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sometimes I hate these old bones of mine... I don't even know whether it's the Dark Tide or just the weight of years that's made me this useless.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll help you find your children.
Don't worry. Leave it to me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you. Young people like you always have such courage.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Before I fainted, I last saw my children running toward the iron gates.

Dialogues.Speaker: Injured Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woo ta ta... Woo ta... Ta ta!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby, Echo interpretation service, please.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Roger that! Your five-star Echo interpreter, at your service! Ahem... Let's try out my new emotional-adaptive mode!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Beep—loading complete! Standing by for interpretation request...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thanks to Abby, you can now understand what the Wootter is saying.

Dialogues.Speaker: Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woo! Danger ahead!

Options.PlotLineKey: Have you seen any children come this way?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Abby relays your words to the Wootter. Its chubby face scrunches up in confusion.

Dialogues.Speaker: Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woo. Wootter sees no one. Very dangerous out there. Big monster!

Dialogues.Speaker: Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wootter and friends protect camp and search outside. Wootter hurt. Must stay here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But Wootter's friends ahead. They help you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Wootter plucks some fur from its body and offers it to you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Follow the scent. It leads you to them!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Interpret that, please, Abby.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Interpreting—

Dialogues.Speaker: Frightened Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woo! So scary!

Dialogues.Speaker: Grateful Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you!

Dialogues.Speaker: Survivor Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whew... If Dark Tide monsters hurt Wootter... Wootter will turn scary too...

Dialogues.Speaker: Survivor Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No! Wootter no want to turn into big scary monster!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Excuse me, have you seen any children around?

Dialogues.Speaker: Survivor Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Children? Human children? Wootter sees no children.

Dialogues.Speaker: Grateful Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Only Wootters and monsters here. No human children.

Dialogues.Speaker: Frightened Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Too dangerous. No human children would play here...

Dialogues.Speaker: Frightened Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woo ta ta ta—! Teeny! Where's Teeny?! Teeny not with us!

Dialogues.Speaker: Survivor Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Teeny... Arctos's Teeny? Did monsters get Teeny?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Grateful Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Save Teeny! Help us! Pleeeassse!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (They said they didn't see any human children. Could this Wooter "Teeny" be one of the children Arctos is looking for?)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Only one way to find out.)

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay, I'll go find Teeny.

Dialogues.Speaker: Grateful Wootter
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, woo! You a good human!

Dialogues.Speaker: "Teeny"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woo... hmm, t-thank you, ta!

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's a serious wound. You shouldn't be fighting like this.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Teeny"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: T-to bring Chunkie back!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Teeny wheezes softly, clearly injured. But its wounds don't dampen its spirit. It looks ready to charge forward again.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Easy now. Just head back to camp and get patched up first. You'll need your strength to do what you came here for.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Teeny"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woo… Okay. Teeny knows where Chunkie is. Teeny should see Arctos first!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Back at the camp, Arctos notices Teeny's wounds and tends to them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you alright, Teeny?

Dialogues.Speaker: "Teeny"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No worry, ta! But... Chunkie still out there...

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's okay, Teeny. I'm just glad you made it back safely.

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So this is one of the children you were looking for?

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes… But as long as "it" is out there, this isn't over.

Dialogues.Speaker: "Teeny"
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Teeny found Chunkie! Chunkie looks strange… hiding in the cave behind big stone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Young warrior, would you be willing to search this cave with us? I should handle this alone, but both Teeny and I are injured...

Dialogues.Speaker: {PlayerName}
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Just leave it to me. You two stay here and rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No… I must see this through and end it with my own hands.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}. My children have all made it home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Teeny
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woo ta, woo ta ta, ta—

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our new camp has been rebuilt as well.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No matter how many times the Dark Tide tears it down, as long as one of us remains standing, it will be rebuilt.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I added the feather Chunkie left behind to the Hornett's tail.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A Hornett's tail is made from the plumes of Gladiator's helmets. Now, I finally understand the significance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Dark Tide may erase our minds, our bodies, but it can never erase our courage to fight back and push forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chunkie was a Gladiator worth honoring.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And no matter how many times the Dark Tide returns, we will rise to meet it, until the applause of triumph echoes through this land once more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That's what Chunkie would've wanted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Arctos
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May applause greet this world again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Reassured Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like the danger has passed. Did you take care of it?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm just a passerby lending a hand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Reassured Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you so much.

Dialogues.Speaker: Reassured Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're too modest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Reassured Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see everyone working hard to rebuild the camp.

Dialogues.Speaker: Reassured Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They look full of spirit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Reassured Gladiator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That puts my mind at ease. Now I can focus on guarding this place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Judging by the tufts of fur scattered on the ground, a fierce fight must've taken place here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sensing the urgency, you press on without delay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Chunkie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Teeny, Arctos, and everyone got away... no one hurt...

Dialogues.Speaker: Chunkie
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Chunkie can go home now...
